intro: Paraboea crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Paraboea crassifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
